metadata.use_case: Baseline use case - COVID-19 vaccines effectiveness assessment
metadata.document: Vaccines effectiveness common data model specification
metadata.description: Data model specification documenting both individual-level and area-level data required to respond to the baseline use case research question about COVID-19 vaccines effectiveness. The data model specification includes the cohort definition, individual-level and area-level variable specification including data dictionaries and crosswalks for semantic interoperable definition of certain variables (i.e. health status, clinical conditions and comorbidities - (def)). See below some of the conventions used to document this data model
metadata.notes: 1.1.2	Adjust cohort definition (study_period, data_extraction_period, cohort_description, inclusion_criteria). Adjusted variable name: doses_nm (before number_doses). Changed "at the time of entering the cohort" to "at the start of enrollment period". Added observation for immunosuppression_bl variable. Adjusted description for variant_cd.

cohort.name: SARS-CoV-2 vaccine effectiveness assessment cohort
cohort.description: All individuals vaccinated with at least one dose of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine (any of the available brands) and all individuals eligible to be vaccinated with a documented positive diagnosis (irrespective of the type of test) for SARS-CoV-2 infection during the data extraction period.
cohort.inclusion_criteria:
All people vaccinated with at least one dose of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine (any of the available brands) in a resident area.
Any person eligible to be vaccinated (from 5 to 115 years old, included) with a positive diagnosis (irrespective of the type of test) for SARS-CoV-2 infection (COVID-19) during the data extraction period.
cohort.exclusion_criteria: People not eligible for the vaccine (from 0 to 4 years old, included)

variables.label: person_id
variables.description: Pseudoid of the person included in the cohort
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: Calculated/derived from person_id encryption or pseudonym generation algorithm

variables.label: age_nm
variables.description: Age of the person included in the cohort (at the start of the enrollment period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database

variables.label: sex_cd
variables.description: Sex of the person included in the cohort (at the start of the enrollment period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database

variables.label: socecon_lvl_cd
variables.description: Socioeconomic level of the person in the cohort (at the start of the enrollment period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: Only if information at individual level available following the categories in which the information is registered. Socio-economic level is covered by the node ResidenceArea in the DAG. See tab 'socecon_lvl_cd (def)' for more information.

variables.label: residence_area_cd
variables.description: Residence area (NUTS 3) of the person in the cohort (at the start of the period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: We assume a person maintains the same residence area during the whole period of analysis

variables.label: country_cd
variables.description: Country doing the analysis
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database

variables.label: foreign_bl
variables.description: Is the country of residence different from the country that is doing the analyses?
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: We assume a person maintains the same country during the whole period of analysis. If country doing the analyses ('country_cd') is different from country of residence then TRUE, else FALSE.

variables.label: exitus_dt
variables.description: Date of death of the person (if the person has died during the study period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: This date is required to prevent right censoring in patients dying after the first dose of the vaccine(s) without SARS-CoV-2 infection

variables.label: exitus_bl
variables.description: Did the person die during the period of study
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: ifelse(exitus_dt != NA, TRUE, FALSE)

variables.label: essential_worker_bl
variables.description: Is the person included in the cohort an essential worker? (at the start of the enrollment period)
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system
variables.observations_comments: See tab 'essential_worker_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: institutionalized_bl
variables.description: Is the person included in the cohort institutionalized? (at the start of the enrollment period)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: See tab 'institutionalized_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: dose_1_brand_cd
variables.description: Brand of first dose of the vaccine
variables.observations_comments: The variable is required, however can have missing values, e.g., when a person is unvaccinated or information is missing

variables.label: dose_1_dt
variables.description: Date of the first dose of the vaccine
variables.observations_comments: The variable is required, however can have missing values, e.g., when a person is unvaccinated or information is missing

variables.label: dose_2_brand_cd
variables.description: Brand of second dose of the vaccine
variables.observations_comments: The variable is required, however can have missing values, e.g., when a person is unvaccinated or information is missing

variables.label: dose_2_dt
variables.description: Date of the second dose of the vaccine
variables.observations_comments: The variable is required, however can have missing values, e.g., when a person is unvaccinated or information is missing

variables.label: dose_3_brand_cd
variables.description: Brand of third dose of the vaccine

variables.label: dose_3_dt
variables.description: Date of the third dose of the vaccine

variables.label: doses_nm
variables.description: Number of doses (independently of the vaccine brand) received by a person during the period of study
variables.observations_comments: Derived from original vaccination registry. It can be greater than 3.

variables.label: fully_vaccinated_dt
variables.description: Date on which the person included in the cohort is considered primary vaccinated
variables.observations_comments: dose_1_dt + 14 days (date of first dose) if dose_1_brand_cd == 'JJ' & dose_1_dt != NA; dose_2_dt + 14 days (date of second dose) if dose_1_brand_cd != 'JJ' & dose_2_dt != NA else NA

variables.label: fully_vaccinated_bl
variables.description: Is the person included in the cohort fully vaccinated?
variables.observations_comments: ifelse(fully_vaccinated_dt != NA, TRUE, FALSE)

variables.label: vaccination_schedule_cd
variables.description: Vaccine types received for 1st and 2nd dose concatenated with hyphen
variables.observations_comments: ifelse(fully_vaccinated_bl == TRUE, str_c(dose_1_brand_cd, " - ", dose_2_brand_cd),  NA) ||  (i.e. 'BP-BP' [two doses and primary vaccinated], 'JJ-' [only one dose but primary vaccinated], '-MD' [only one dose registered as a second dose, no information on the first dose but a date, and assumed to have received both doses of Moderna vaccine])

variables.label: confirmed_case_dt
variables.description: Date of diagnosis or positive test result of the first known/confirmed infection
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system
variables.observations_comments: Date of diagnosis or positive test result of the first known/confirmed infection after 2021-01-01 (SARS-CoV-2 vaccine roll-out) for individuals who haven't completed a primary vaccination schedule or after being considered primary vaccinated

variables.label: confirmed_case_bl
variables.description: Did the individual experience a known/confirmed infection after 2021-01-01?
variables.observations_comments: Did the individual experience a known/confirmed infection after 2021-01-01 (SARS-CoV-2 vaccine roll-out) for individuals who haven't completed a primary vaccination schedule or after being considered primary vaccinated?

variables.label: previous_infection_dt
variables.description: Date of diagnosis or positive test result of the first known/confirmed infection before 2021-01-01 (
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system

variables.label: previous_infection_bl
variables.description: Did the person experience a known/confirmed infection before 2021-01-01 (SARS-CoV-2 vaccine roll-out
variables.observations_comments: ifelse(previous_infection_dt != NA, TRUE, FALSE)

variables.label: test_type_cd
variables.description: Type of COVID-19 test for last known SARS-CoV-2 infection
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system
variables.observations_comments: This test refers only to the positive test that lead to the diagnosis confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 infection (confirmed_case_dt), thus a person primary or partially vaccinated can have 20 negative tests and this variable will be missing (empty). Can be used for sensitivity analysis.

variables.label: variant_cd
variables.description: Identified variant (WHO label) for confirmed SARS-CoV-2 case
variables.observations_comments: Restricted to Variants of Concern (VOC) and Variants of Interest (VOI) (see https://www.who.int/en/activities/tracking-SARS-CoV-2-variants/ ). Can be used for stratified analysis.

variables.label: diabetes_bl
variables.description: Does the person have type II diabetes at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'diabetes_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: obesity_bl
variables.description: Does the person have obesity at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'obesity_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: heart_failure_bl
variables.description: Does the person have heart failure at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'heart_failure_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: copd_bl
variables.description: Does the person have chronic lung disease at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'copd_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: solid_tumor_without_metastasis_bl
variables.description: Does the person have solid cancer without metastasis at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'solid_tumor_without_metastatis_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: chronic_kidney_disease_bl
variables.description: Does the person have chronic kidney disease at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'chronic_kidney_disease_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: sickle_cell_disease_bl
variables.description: Does the person have sickle cell disease at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'sickle_cell_disease_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: hypertension_bl
variables.description: Does the person have hypertension at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'hypertension_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: chronic_liver_disease_bl
variables.description: Does the person have chronic liver disease at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'chronic_liver_disease_bl (def)' for more information. (see https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/COVID-19-vaccination-and-prioritisation-strategies.pdf)

variables.label: blood_cancer_bl
variables.description: Does the person have blood cancer (leukemia) at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'blood_cancer_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: transplanted_bl
variables.description: Is the person a transplant patient at enrollment?
variables.standard_classification: crosswalks (ICD-10, ICD-9, SNOMED-CT, might be procedure)
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'transplanted_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: hiv_infection_bl
variables.description: Does the person have HIV infection at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'hiv_infection_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: primary_immunodeficiency_bl
variables.description: Does the person have primary immuno deficiency disease (lymphoma) at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'primary_immunodeficiency_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: immunosuppression_bl
variables.description: Does the person have drugs induced immunosuppression at enrollment?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'immunosuppression_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: pregnancy_bl
variables.description: Is the person included in the cohort pregnant (at the start of the enrollment period)?
variables.observations_comments: (primary care or hospitalization episodes with main diagnosis included in the variable definition) See tab 'pregnancy_bl (def)' for more information.

variables.label: calendar_date_dt
variables.description: Date from 01-03-2020 onwards
variables.observations_comments: Generate the interval based on a function

variables.label: residence_area_cd
variables.description: Administrative areas (NUTS 3)
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: We assume a person maintains the same residence area during the whole period of analysis

variables.label: residence_area_nuts2_cd
variables.description: Administrative areas (NUTS 2)

variables.label: country_cd
variables.description: Country
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: We assume a person maintains the same residence area during the whole period of analysis

variables.label: socecon_lvl_area_nm
variables.description: Ratio of population in the lowest quintile of income versus highest quintile of income for a certain
variables.possible_data_source: Insurance registry or Health system users database
variables.observations_comments: This parameter will depend on the information available at area level along time in open official sources (i.e. Eurostat, or other)

variables.label: test_positivity_percentage_area_nm
variables.description: Percentage of positive SARS-CoV-2 tests out of total SARS-CoV-2 tests performed
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system
variables.observations_comments: This test refers only to the positive test that lead to the diagnosis confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 infection, thus a person fully or partially vaccinated can have 20 negative tests and this variable will be missing (empty)

variables.label: cumulative_confirmed_cases_nm
variables.description: Cumulative number of confirmed cases since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic
variables.possible_data_source: COVID-19 public health surveillance and monitoring information system

variables.label: variant_area_cd
variables.description: Predominant Identified variant (WHO label) circulating in each region at each time
variables.observations_comments: restricted to Variants of Concern (VOC) and Variants of Interest (VOI) (see https://www.who.int/en/activities/tracking-SARS-CoV-2-variants/)
